subject: Gardening
title: Ant Dispersal: Seeds With Snacks
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Ant Dispersal: Seeds With Snacks.

hook.text: Violets, bloodroot, and trilliums attach fatty snacks to their seeds. Ants carry them home, eat the snack.

buildup.text: Myrmecochoryâ€”ant dispersalâ€”relies on elaiosomes: lipid-rich appendages attached to seeds that ants find irresistible.

discovery.text: Ants carry seeds underground to nutrient-rich nest middens. The discarded seed germinates in ideal conditions.

twist.text: Over 11,000 plant species use myrmecochory. It's independently evolved in 100+ plant families worldwide.

climax.text: Ant dispersal is a bribe economy. Seeds pay with fat, ants pay with burial and fertilization. Everybody profits.

punchline.text: 11,000 species pay ants in fat to plant their seeds.

quiz.question: What is an elaiosome?
options: A sticky substance that helps seeds adhere to animal fur
A lipid-rich appendage on seeds that attracts ants as dispersers
A chemical signal that seeds release to attract pollinators
